abstract.p: Richard Salyer letter responds to May 28 article on Santa Cruz, Calif; deplores city council's misguided benevolence in creating 'safe sleeping zones' for homeless people (M)

block.p: Shame on Santa Cruz, Calif. (Santa Cruz Journal, May 28). That no one should live on the streets should, by now, be painfully obvious to all. Shame on Santa Cruz, Calif. (Santa Cruz Journal, May 28). That no one should live on the streets should, by now, be painfully obvious to all. The City Council's misguided benevolence in creating ''safe sleeping zones'' will not only worsen homelessness but also jeopardize the health and safety of the very people the Council wants to help.

Homelessness is not mysterious or incurable. But most people who are chronically homeless have more complicated needs and more human problems than their lack of a ''home.'' Communities should stop all activities that enable people living on the streets to continue their destructive lifestyle. We must also provide services that address their underlying problems. Only then will we see the beginning of the end of homelessness.
The writer is president of Volunteers of America, Greater New York.
